moves.1. e4: Here is a game, where black missed a chance to get the advantage by winning a pawn, and after this white released a straight forward and lethal attack against black king.
moves.1... c5 2. Nf3 Nc6 3. d4: the Sicilian defence, one of my favourite openings as black, but i also like to play against it with white, because often you get many open lines, which can lead to rather interesting games whit alot of action and tactics.
moves.3... cxd4 4. Nxd4 g6 5. Nc3 Bg7 6. Be3 d: Here i totally missed the following tactic, but luckily for me, so did my opponent.
moves.8... O-O 9. O-O Nxe4: Here i just though to myself, that i could get the pawn back after the few next moves somehow, but i didn't need to.
moves.10. Nxe4 Nxd4 11. Bxd4: Here i thought that surely d5, would be good, but for some reason black didn't play that
moves.11... Bf5: Bf5? this just leaves white a piece up.
moves.12. Bxg7 Kxg7 13. Ng3 Bd7 14. Rfe1: Preparing a rook lift to deliver a mate on h7.
moves.14... Kg8 15. Re4 Bc6: This just speeds up whites plan.
moves.16. Rh4 e5: black missed the following lethal move
moves.17. Qh6: And black resigned, he would have to give up his queen for a rook to stay off the mate.

opening: Sicilian (B35), accelerated fianchetto, modern variation with Bc4
